summary: Customs and Border Protection's Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism program aims to balance supply chain efficiency and security. It provides benefits like reduced inspections of U.S.-bound cargo to "low-risk" private companies that voluntarily comply with certain security standards. We found that 480 program participants were involved in about 2,200 security incidents from FYs 2020 to 2024. These incidents included introducing restricted or prohibited cargo, such...
title: Supply Chain Security: Actions Needed to Improve CBP Management of the Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism Program
